name: LinkedIn Live / Event
primary_goal_vibe: Thoughtful live sessions, webinars, and professional events designed to deliver value and drive attendance, leads, or relationship-building.
tone_preference: Professional, structured, and outcome-focused. Friendly enough to encourage participation.

copy_guidelines.copy_best_practices: Use a clear, benefit-driven event title. The description must explain what the session covers, who it is for, and what attendees will gain. Include logistics such as time, format, and how to join. Highlight speakers or hosts.
copy_guidelines.caption_structure_hint: Title: benefit and topic. Short intro: 1–2 lines about why this session matters now. Details: bullet points for agenda, speakers, and key takeaways. Final lines: direct CTA to register or attend live.
copy_guidelines.recommended_caption_length: Short to medium, with heavy use of bullets for clarity.
cta_examples: Register to get notified when we go live
Click Attend to save your spot
Join us live for the Q&A

event_structure_guidelines.primary_role: Set expectations and remove friction for attendance.
best_practices: Clarify if the session will be recorded
Highlight the main learning outcomes in bullet points

hashtags_mentions.hashtag_strategy: Use the same tags across event promotions to keep them connected.
hashtags_mentions.mention_strategy: Tag speakers, co-hosts, and partner companies in the event description and promotional posts.

technical_constraints.format_note: Specify whether it is a LinkedIn Live or an external platform link.
technical_constraints.reminder_behavior: Attendees receive notifications as the event approaches.
technical_constraints.replay_note: Indicate if replay will be available.

required_elements: Clear explanation of topic and audience
disallowed_practices: Vague event titles with no clear topic
Missing or unclear time and date
Overly promotional copy without value explanation
Not stating who the event is for
